metadata.title: Land Use Conflicts and Synergies on Agricultural Land in Brandenburg, Germany

data_sources.description: The dataset represents the annual area of land use divided into six categories for the period from 1995 to 2020. It was used to derive the amount of annual land use change and potential land use conflicts that accompany the loss of agricultural area.

An online survey conducted with farmers to identify land use conflicts they faced and land use systems they are targeting to establish synergies. Conducted from March 20, 2021, to May 20, 2021, with 178 participants, of which 118 responses were analyzed.

data_sources.source_name: Integrated Administration and Control System (IACS) Data
data_sources.description: IACS data from 2020 used to identify areas set aside under greening or agri-environmental and climate measures, and to localize conflict areas between agricultural production and environmental protection.

assessment.findability_reason: Data sources are mentioned in the publication but not all have direct links or identifiers.
assessment.accessibility_reason: Some data sources are publicly available, while others are restricted or require specific access conditions.
assessment.interoperability_reason: Data formats and standards are not specified, limiting interoperability.
assessment.reusability_reason: Limited metadata and lack of persistent identifiers reduce reusability.
